intro: Duguetia coriacea, commonly known as the rough-leaved evergreen, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dark green, rough-textured leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces small, red fruits that are edible and often consumed by birds and mammals. Duguetia coriacea is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
